item.title: How NFT video games crashed and burned | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Nintendo The NFT gaming community only grew more niche and scam-filled in 2022 Less than 12 months ago, it felt as if 2022 would be the year NFTs took off in the video game world. Companies l...
item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo The NFT gaming community only grew more niche and scam-filled in 2022 Less than 12 months ago, it felt as if 2022 would be the year NFTs took off in the video game world. Companies like EA, Ubisoft, Square Enix, Zynga, Niantic, and Take-Two Interactive all, at one point, said that they were brainstorming ways to add NFTs into their games. The idea being that non-fungible tokens would replace everything from loot boxes to character skins to even characters themselves. But none o...

item.content:encoded: Image: Square Enix Chocobo GP will get no more seasons, no more Mythril Square Enix is winding down support for its kart racer, Chocobo GP, on Nintendo Switch, the publisher announced this week. There will be ‚Äúno further large scale updates,‚Äù including new characters or new maps, for Chocobo GP, Square Enix said. item.content:encoded: Graphic: James Bareham/Polygon ‚ÄòDesign scaffolding‚Äô supported Tunic‚Äôs vibrant, challenging approach 2022 was a strange time for video games. I‚Äôve already taken to calling it ‚Äúthe chaotic-good year‚Äù of releases. (It has yet to catch on.) With just a handful of blockbuster tentpoles, the door was open for several ongoing games to finally capture our attention; for seemingly redundant sequels to easily win our hearts; and for indie games of all shapes and sizes to make themselves known. And few e...

item.description: Image: CD Projekt Red Sign of the times The new version of The Witcher 3 comes with major graphical upgrades, a photo mode, new content inspired by the Netflix show, and a raft of quality-of-life im...
item.content:encoded: Image: CD Projekt Red Sign of the times The new version of The Witcher 3 comes with major graphical upgrades, a photo mode, new content inspired by the Netflix show, and a raft of quality-of-life improvements, tweaks, and fixes. Taken together, the update is a welcome and compelling reason to revisit this modern classic, but in all honesty ‚Äî as our review pointed out ‚Äî few of these changes have a massive material impact on the experience. As you play, the last seven and a half years melt away,...

item.description: Posted by Jinsung Yoon and Sercan O. Arik, Research Scientists, Google Research, Cloud AI Team Analysis of Electronic Health Records (EHR) has a tremendous potential for enhancing patient care, quanti...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Jinsung Yoon and Sercan O. Arik, Research Scientists, Google Research, Cloud AI Team Analysis of Electronic Health Records (EHR) has a tremendous potential for enhancing patient care, quantitatively measuring performance of clinical practices, and facilitating clinical research. Statistical estimation and machine learning (ML) models trained on EHR data can be used to predict the probability of various diseases (such as diabetes), track patient wellness, and predict how patients respon...

item.description: Posted by Pritish Kamath and Pasin Manurangsi, Research Scientists, Google Research Differential privacy (DP) is an approach that enables data analytics and machine learning (ML) with a mathematical g...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Pritish Kamath and Pasin Manurangsi, Research Scientists, Google Research Differential privacy (DP) is an approach that enables data analytics and machine learning (ML) with a mathematical guarantee on the privacy of user data. DP quantifies the ‚Äúprivacy cost‚Äù of an algorithm, i.e., the level of guarantee that the algorithm‚Äôs output distribution for a given dataset will not change significantly if a single user‚Äôs data is added to or removed from it. The algorithm is characterized by tw...

item.description: Posted by Tal Schuster, Research Scientist, Google Research Language models (LMs) are the driving force behind many recent breakthroughs in natural language processing. Models like T5, LaMDA, GPT-3, a...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Tal Schuster, Research Scientist, Google Research Language models (LMs) are the driving force behind many recent breakthroughs in natural language processing. Models like T5, LaMDA, GPT-3, and PaLM have demonstrated impressive performance on various language tasks. While multiple factors can contribute to improving the performance of LMs, some recent studies suggest that scaling up the model‚Äôs size is crucial for revealing emergent capabilities. In other words, some instances can be so...

item.title: How To Overcome The Fear of Math and Learn Math For Data Science | KDnuggets
item.description: Many aspiring Data Scientists, especially when self-learning, fail to learn the necessary math foundations. These recommendations for learning approaches along with references to valuable resources ca...
item.content:encoded: Many aspiring Data Scientists, especially when self-learning, fail to learn the necessary math foundations. These recommendations for learning approaches along with references to valuable resources can help you overcome a personal sense of not being "the math type" or belief that you "always failed in math."

item.title: Sentiment Analysis on Encrypted Data with Homomorphic Encryption | KDnuggets
item.description: This blog post uses the Concrete-ML library, allowing data scientists to use machine learning models in fully homomorphic encryption (FHE) settings without any prior knowledge of cryptography. We prov...
item.content:encoded: This blog post uses the Concrete-ML library, allowing data scientists to use machine learning models in fully homomorphic encryption (FHE) settings without any prior knowledge of cryptography. We provide a practical tutorial on how to use the library to build a sentiment analysis model on encrypted data.

item.description: Posted by Quan Wang, Senior Staff Software Engineer, and Fan Zhang, Staff Software Engineer, Google In 2019 we launched Recorder, an audio recording app for Pixel phones that helps users create, manag...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Quan Wang, Senior Staff Software Engineer, and Fan Zhang, Staff Software Engineer, Google In 2019 we launched Recorder, an audio recording app for Pixel phones that helps users create, manage, and edit audio recordings. It leverages recent developments in on-device machine learning to transcribe speech, recognize audio events, suggest tags for titles, and help users navigate transcripts. Nonetheless, some Recorder users found it difficult to navigate long recordings that have multiple ...

item.content:encoded: Posted Keerthana Gopalakrishnan and Kanishka Rao, Google Research, Robotics at Google Major recent advances in multiple subfields of machine learning (ML) research, such as computer vision and natural language processing, have been enabled by a shared common approach that leverages large, diverse datasets and expressive models that can absorb all of the data effectively. Although there have been various attempts to apply this approach to robotics, robots have not yet leveraged highly-capable mod...
